E3 Report, Day One
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2005 Topics (Year of the Mocchi Scream): E3 Report, Day One
By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, May 18, 2005 - 08:31 pm:

The expo portion of E3 started today. I arrived with about two hours left in the day. As usual, Wednesday was incredibly busy for everyone! Japanese television was taping interviews with the Tecmo staff, so I just got a few hurried greetings with most people. I did manage to get an official Tecmo t-shirt that says "Our Girls Are Better Than Yours" which only the staff are being issued -these are not a public giveaway. (Yes, I got it in the models' dressing room.)

I did have a chance to speak to the wireless developer for a few minutes and he had some great news: Tecmo Japan has just approved the US to start converting Monster Rancher Pop for cell phones! I have no details about it, and presumeably it will take some time to translate and convert (Japanese mobiles are a lot more advanced than ours.)

I saw some footage from the upcoming Tecmo games (FF3, Deception, Tecmo Arcade Classics, NG Black, DOA4), and they look great! The models were, as usual, lovely and wearing cool costumes.

I'll be spending more time with the gang tomorrow and the next day. Things are a little easier as the show gets closer to ending.
